page.title: 15 Antony House cont.1
page.content: _] family were ashamed of him.Later his painting was rescued and sewn back in, you can see the stiches where this was done. We also saw the painting of Sir Coventry Carew who founded our school in 1766 and also of Richard Carew who wrote the famous "Survey of Cornwall". As we went around the house among the splendid antique furniture in the bedrooms were a few modern appliances and photographs showing that the rooms are still used today by the Carew-Pole family whose home it still is. The Carew-Pole family are friends with the Royal family and whenever a member the Royal family is in the area they usually either visit or stay in Antony House. Today the house is owned by the National Trust and has thousands of visitors each year.
